column2: Job Summary  :  Quality Analyst is responsible for monitoring and evaluating the performance of call centre representatives to ensure that customer service standards are met or exceeded. This role involves assessing agents' interactions with customers, providing feedback, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing strategies to enhance overall customer satisfaction. Job Description :  Quality Monitoring: Monitor and evaluate outbound calls handled by call centre   representatives to assess customer service quality and adherence to established         protocols and standards.  Performance Evaluation: Analyse calls to identify trends and areas for improvement.  Feedback and Coaching: Provide constructive feedback to call centre agents based on quality monitoring evaluations, highlighting areas of strength and opportunities for development. Conduct coaching sessions to help agents improve their communication skills, product knowledge, and problem- solving abilities.  Quality Assurance Procedures: Develop and implement quality assurance procedures, guidelines, and best practices to ensure consistency and compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and service level agreements(SLAs).  Data Analysis and Reporting: Compile and analyse quality assurance data to generate reports, dashboards, and presentations for management review. Identify root causes of quality issues and recommend corrective actions to address them.  Training and Development: Assist in the development and delivery of training programs and   materials for call centre agents, focusing on customer service techniques, product knowledge, system navigation, and other relevant skills.  Collaboration: Collaborate with call centre managers, supervisors, and other stakeholders to   identify opportunities for process improvement, performance optimization, and customer   experience enhancement.  Quality Initiatives: Participate in quality improvement initiatives and projects aimed at   enhancing call centre operations, driving efficiency, and achieving customer service excellence. Minimum Requirements: Graduate Male candidate with proven experience in a call centre environment, with at least 1-2 years of experience in quality assurance or quality monitoring roles preferably outbound sales. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvement. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to provide clear and actionable feedback to call centre agents. Solid understanding of call centre operations, customer service principles, and quality assurance methodologies. Proficiency in using call monitoring software, quality management systems, and Microsoft Office applications (e.g., Excel,PowerPoint). Certification in quality assurance or related field (e.g., Six Sigma, COPC, Lean) is a plus. Ready to work with US shifts Available to join immediately.
